snippet: It’s impossible to view Henry Wachtel, who is charged with killing his mother, apart from the life suggested in a film about troubled teenagers.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column describes how lives of Henry Wachtel and Duncan Figurski, two troubled Manhattan teenagers, inspired filmmakers Tatianna Kantorowicz and Danielle DiGiacomo to make film Our Time; notes that Wachtel and Figurski starred in the film, which seeks to convey the alienation and despair of children of families that are neither affluent nor impoverished and for whom the idealization of a middle class life is out of reach.
lead_paragraph: It’s impossible to view Henry Wachtel, who is charged with killing his mother, apart from the life suggested in a film about troubled teenagers.

headline.print_headline: A Killing, And Queries About a Life
headline.seo: In Henry Wachtel Tragedy, Asking Where Fiction and Reality Diverge
headline.main: A Killing, and Queries About a Life
